Look, I watch a lot of comedy shows. I like funny stuff and there’s a lot of unfunny shit out there for you to sieve through. And it is true that not all people have the same sense of humour so I’ll say off the bat to not waste your time: if deadpan and sarcastic humour is not your thing then you might not find this show as hysterical as I did.
Now, I am pretty particular about what I rate shows (this gets relevant). For example, most shows I rate on a 1-10 scale, yet with comedies my rating is a little different. One ofmy favourite shows is Keroro Gunso (which I have mentioned here before as being absolutely fantastic) and it is a comedy. I believe that as a comedy it is so good that it deserves to be a whole rating above any other comedy show. Therefore, the highest rating I will give to a comedy show is a nine and the only comedy show to get as high as a nine is Cromartie High School (another show I have mentioned before). So my top two comedy shows are literally, in my eyes, in tiers of their own. Nothing else is on the same level as them.

Except Saiki Kusuo No PSI-nan. I gave this show the most difficult nine I have ever given a show in my life. Not because I was debating if really was that good but because I was having such a hard time deciding if it should be a nine or a ten. The only reason it’s not a ten is because the show has a few episodes which aren’t up to the same comedic standards as all the other episodes. That’s it. That is the only problem. Now, onto the good stuff.


In the hours and hours of watching this there were many times when I had full on fits of laughter. I haven’t laughed this much since watching Bo Burnham for the first time. And I’m not kidding when I say there are tears and hyperventilating levels of funny in this show. It’s so easy to digest the show, with each episode only lasting around five minutes which means it’s filled with great moments and does not try to drag out one concept for twenty minutes. There’s no real story here, it really is just putting Saiki, an all-powerful deadpan psychic, in scenes with the wacky supporting cast and letting them bounce off of each other. The dialogue is fast and the jokes are plentiful so in every five minute episodes there are going to be several jokes that are guaranteed to land with most audiences.


Sound is not something I usually talk about. Openings and endings don’t really bother me, neither does the voice acting. As long as I can understand what they’re saying (in terms of dubs) or the tone doesn’t irritate me (in terms of subs where the audio is in Japanese) then I’m fine. But oh my god is the dub in this show amazing. Like I said, the jokes come thick and fast and you really won’t have the time to read and digest the subtitles and will really leave you feeling exhausted. This is a show which really does benefit from having an English dub available as you can just sit back and listen as Saiki quickly and sarcastically takes the utter piss out of all his classmates whilst also breaking the fourth wall. It really is a beautiful thing to experience.

If you think you will enjoy "Daily Lives of High School Boys," "Haven't You Heard? I'm Sakamoto," or even "Handa-kun," with the same touch of fun awkward social skills, mixed with a twist of psychic powers, and Captain Levi's indifferent yet sexy voice, this anime is for you! The Disastrous Life of Saiki K is definitely a great watch and is ready to surprise you again and again. Just when I finish an episode and think "they can't get any funnier than that," Saiki K exceeds expectations. The show presented a mixture of slapstick, farcical, hyperbolic, and even blue humor.
Art that was used was nothingspecial, just pleasant to the eyes, I guess. The same can be said about the soundtrack/effects. Captain Levi (Hiroshi Kamiya)'s voice was definitely a plus to me, but that's jut my personal opinion. \n\n
The trouble with slice-of-life series is that there is often no continuity and most characters seem one-dimensional. Especially with personas such as Saiki's, who are omnipotent and omniscient, it is difficult to get a plot that causes growth. But as the story progresses, we are able to see subtle changes in his interactions with his so-called friends and classmates. During those times, however, Saiki should not have to explain himself whenever he does any altruistic action (i.e. I will help this person because it will benefit me, not because I want to help). All these justifications make him seem so tsundere... perhaps I was just overthinking for an otherwise simple, comedic anime.

Without a doubt my favorite comedy anime, I am one of those who comedy in anime does not like but this anime gets so absurd situations with the interaction between the characters that it is impossible that you do not get at least a smile.
Although it seems that the episodes do not have continuity between them, the actions of the characters do affect the story and in my opinion it gives a special touch since not many comedy animes do that.
There are also surprises in the plot that I personally did not expect and more than once they made me say "loooool", as for example-SPOILER- The revelation of a student who can communicate with ghosts or that Saiki has a brother.- SPOILER-

Really an anime that I recommend to everyone and that all otako should know.

I want to premise this review with a statement: Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan is a(n) comedy anime; there is no plot, storyline, drama, or any other aspect of the show other than comedy for which it should be reviewed. Therefore, the following review and the score I've given this show are in relation to how well the show preformed as a comedy anime. 
Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan follows the eventful life of Saiki Kusuo: a young man who happens to have been born with every psychic power one could imagine. With such powers it's no surprise that Saiki's life is so eventful; however it's notSaiki himself who creates this busy and energetic life, it's his eccentric and out-going group of friends. Saiki, if anything, wishes for a quiet and simple life; his friends however don't have the same agenda. In the midst of attempting to hide his psychic powers, manage his bustling group of friends, and deal with his giddy family; hilarity ensues. 


Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan is by no means a story driven anime. It's a succession of short 4 minute episodes which are meant to make you laugh. The show is meant to perform and express itself as a comedy, which is does very well. Each character is hand-crafted to be unique enough that they pique your curiosity and get you to laugh when they come around. All the way from a(n) eighth-grade syndrome inflicted boy fighting off the notorious "Dark Reunion," to a self-absorbed bishoujo you'll find that each character comes off in their own way and does a fantastic job of adding to the show's comedy.


Each skit presented within the anime made me laugh; I found there was rarely a dull moment and none of the anime's writing came off as lackluster or poorly done. Each joke has substance, and it reminded me of the same style expressed by latter series Gintama.


The art and music are fantastic for improving the show's atmosphere and comedic vibe. I need not stumble too far into reviewing the art and music, because there's not much in this area I'm looking to comment on; however I did want to leave something here that you'll understand once you've seen the show, something which should sum up my feelings on the music selection in the anime: "JUDGEMENT KNIGHTS OF ♫"


If you're on the prowl for a good comedy anime, do not pass up Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan. I strongly recommend this show to anyone reading this review; get ready for a good laugh and some light-hearted fun. Hope to see everyone here for Season 2!

At first I was skeptical because cliche storylines with overwhelming powers due to western super hero movies and long Japanese fights with a complicated backstory. However this story was as humorous as watching viral youtube animation shorts. 
The short duration of each episode lessens the cliffhanger hiatus feel when there is a long plot build up. This show illustrate the complete opposite. It feels like if Sakamoto from "Sakamoto desu ga?" were the main character with a "One Punch Man" vibe of the main character being overpowered but doesn't care about anything but food.
Pretty much that. I highly recommend for anyone with little free timeto watch this because it is a good way to relax for a short time without feeling anxiety over the entire plot.

I'd honestly never thought I'd find a comedy anime as enjoyable as Danshi Koukousei no Nichijou was for me. TL;DR, show's real funny and worth watching, got it? Alright, go!
It's rare that any anime that has a comedy tag would make me literally laugh out loud, and only a handful have, this included along with Flying Witch and Danshi Koukousei no Nichijou. Expecting that this show would be mediocre in it's comedy aspect at best, the only reason I started watching this show was due to the fact that it was on Netflix and I had like a free weekend to burn doing nothing.
So basically,this show's protagonist, Saiki Kusou, has phenomenal psychic powers, cool right? Well no, as his magnificent his powers seem they have their own drawbacks, as such Saiki is bombarded with the thoughts of everyone within a certain radius of him. Thus he tries his absolute hardest to live a peaceful and simple life devoid of anything exciting or anything that he may deem tiring or a waste of time, which is the entire premise of this show. This achieves a blend of being somewhat able to relate to Saiki's daily problems to a certain degree that makes his efforts to avoid such interactions enjoyably funny.


The characters are memorable and the voice actors have done a great job portraying the characters as intended as per their individual introductions and have brought them to a realistic enough standard that I can imagine myself in Saiki's shoes and would react in the same ways he would. Also, specifically Kamiya Hiroshi who voiced our lovely protagonist, his experience with inter-monologues and his elaborate thought processes that we have seen also from the Monogatari series is a perfect match for each other. 


The art and sound effects could be better, but they definitely suffice for an anime such as this since it does not look for beautiful animation and sound track within high tension situations or scenes.


The music is decent (???), albeit not very memorable but as far as I remember managed to fit themselves nicely within certain themes / emotions in the show. 


Overall, a comedy anime has not much plot to judge on in my opinion, and has fulfilled it's task of making a enjoyable comedy anime that is worth watching. This show does well the same way Danshi Koukousei no Nichijou does, provide a non-offensive show with minimal plot and focus on the moments that people could relate to on a personal level which creates enjoyment from watching.

Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan ( The Disastrous Life of Saiki ) is a story following our main protagonist Saiki and his naturally born-with psychic powers. Saiki frequently encounters disastrous events ( as the title suggests ) in which Saiki must deal with, without alerting his friends of his supernatural powers.
  What makes this anime so special, is the fact that Saiki's powers are blatantly used to cover anything illogical in the world. Look at any other anime and you'll definitely find plot holes and/or mistakes in the writing of some events or the setting of the world, Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan gainsit comedic value by blaming all of the illogical themes and features of the anime on poor Saiki. Supporting characters in the anime further prove this as they all fit extreme cliches in anime, to the point where you might see them or their behavior in people in real life, and you'll become surprisingly attached to them in no time. 


  With a nice story, suitable art style, and surprisingly well though out characters, Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan brings out a very enjoyable experience, probably the best gag anime ever. I came into this anime not really expecting anything worthwhile, finished it in one sitting.

This is what we want more of!! Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan captures the comedy used in Gintama perfectly and since Gintama is my favorite anime of all time Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan is now the runner up.
The anime is absolutely ridiculous, the main character is basically an extremely overpowered character that could do whatever he wants. However he views his abilities as terribly inconvenient to have and just wants to live a normal live. But that can't happen with all the other "special" characters around him.
Just like Gintama this anime thrives by throwing together ridiculous characters in all kinds of situations and then chain togetherjokes one after another until you can't stop laughing.

This review contains no spoilers, because then the review would be pointless.
So, it's been a month since I've watched Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan (also known as the Disastrous Life of Saiki K.) Since then, I still believe that is probably the best show I have ever watched, and for many reasons. It is hilarious, the voice casting is perfect, each episode is condensed perfectly into eight minute bits, and it has a story that pulls the viewer in. 
Assuming you read the synopsis, onto the review we go!
STORY
Rated: 9/10
The story, which some would argue is the most important part of the show, is great. However,this isn't only due to the main character, or the way the episodes are structured. No, I give the credit to the supporting characters, who all have different personalities and goals. Take, for example, Nendou Riki. Nendou is, simply put, an idiot. So much of an idiot that Saiki can't use simple telepathy to see what Nendou is thinking. However, this only propels the story forward, as the most unexpected things can come this doofus that the audience soon grows to love. We'll go more in depth in the Character section, but the blend of supporting characters and the main character is simply put, amazing.


As I mentioned above, each episode is around eight to ten minutes long. If you watched this series on Netflix, like I did, then you'll see that four episodes are squeezed into one single episode, which surprisingly works. These episodes, who manage to put a background, story, and solution in only eight minutes, are a piece of art. A conflict can usually be resolved in eight minutes, but each episode helps develop a character more, whether it be developing a new power of Saiki's, or adding a new motivation or reason to befriend/annoy Saiki. 


Lastly, the comedic presence and timing of this show is great. It makes sure not to overflow us with jokes, but each joke usually hits at home with the audience. There are several instances which I can pull up but won't due to spoilers, but the writing isn't only it. The art style of this anime, which is soft and goes smoothly with mostly any background, can also add to the comedy of this show. 


However, there are some negatives to the story. Mainly, the lack of a continuous story can be annoying at times, as well as forgetting what happened in previous episodes due to the shortness of them. However, the positives vastly outnumber the negatives, and make the story very, very enjoyable.


Whew. Sorry about the long Story section, but it's probably the most important part of a show, so I had to include as much as I could.


ART

Rated 7/10


The art of the show isn't anything amazing. There are no action packed fight scenes which involve Saiki fighting an alien or anything like that. As I mentioned above, the art is very soft, and the only time we see bold lines is when Saiki is getting serious. However, the background art is very pretty, whether it be the beach, Saiki's house, or the high school. The art for this show gets the bare minimum done, and it honestly doesn't need anything else. While the art can be lacking, for this type of comedic show, it can work perfectly.


SOUND

Rated 10/10


God, I love the sounds that this show makes. Each character, save for Saiki, has a mini theme that goes along perfectly with their character. I'll give the example of Kaidou Shun. Kaidou Shun is another "friend" of Saiki's, who has a hero complex. Whenever he goes into his alter ego, a member of a secret society where all the members have powers, mysterious music plays, usually stereotyped as something dark and interesting is about to happen. However, what usually happens next is Kaidou embarrassing himself. The audio helps majorly the comedic timing of the show.

Also, the intro and outro songs of the show is effin amazing and I love all of them to bits.


CHARACTER

Rated 10/10


Holy hell. The characters in this anime are, simply put, amazing. I'll put a list of them and some characteristics, and then describe them a bit more.


Kusuo Saiki- The protagonists of this anime. He has psychic powers, and is pretty damn powerful. He also just wants to be left alone by his friends and family.


Shun Kaidou- A companion of Saiki, who thinks that he is a hero called Jet Black Wings, where he has to stop the evil organization Dark Reunion. In reality, he's a dorky kid with an overbearing mother and too much time on his hands.


Nendou Riki-Another companion of Saiki's, he is an idiot who's mind can't be read. Literally. He enjoys ramen and hanging out with Saiki. Later into the anime, he is considered a "rival" by Kineshi Hairo, although Nendou isn't aware of this. His father died when he was a child, and his father's ghost haunts Saiki from time to time.


Kineshi Hairo- The jock of the group, he loves motivating his classmates and playing sports. He doesn't back down to any challenge, and isn't afraid to strip down to his underwear to represent his school. Can be overenthusiastic at times.


Kokomi Teruhashi- Literally every man's love interest, she is a high schooler who just wants to get Saiki to say "Wow!" at her good looks. Is friends with Chiyo Yumehara. Her brother has a crush on her. Her father probably does as well.



That's really the main group. They all have such great dynamic together that it's honestly pretty amazing that the anime managed to pull it off. There are other smaller characters, such as Saiki's parents, but that group is probably the best part of the anime.


ENJOYMENT

Rated 10/10


Just watch the damn show. It's so good. I throughly enjoyed it, and am surprised that it isn't more popular. There is only a sub out right now, but even if you don't like subs, you'll enjoy this one. Watch. The. Show.


ENDING REMARKS

The Disastrous Life of Saiki K will forever hold a special place in my heart as one of the first animes that made me burst out laughing and always made me happy. If I was offered to watch it again, I would 100% take that opportunity. So, Overall, I give it a 10/10, and can't WAIT to watch the second season.

It really does help me with my reviews, as I can see and look at what I can improve when writing. Not only that, but if you want to follow my profile to see what I write a review on next, that would be great! Thanks for reading, and have a great day!

Saiki Kusuo no ψ-nan is a short-segment comedy about an-all powerful psychic high school student trying to pass as average. As unique as Saiki is-his friends are just as colorful. Yet, as much of a hassle they are to Saiki, deep down he probably likes them. Well, he at least tolerates them. 
The humor is quick and the jokes come one after another-it doesn’t leave you much time to think. There’s not an overarching plot, but snapshots of Saiki’s life. His deadpan narration makes him the straight man to the world around him and with this I would say Saiki is a good comedy anime.


What makes Saiki great is how much the show does with such little time. Through these short moments the characters shine and are so endearing. The show plays on the tropes and clichés it presents so well. Each character proves and subverts his/her labels continuously, proving you can’t judge at face value. In fact, the show literally called me out on this later on in the series. 


As a side note I’ll say I watched this series in the standard 24-minute episode format, which I would recommend since the entire series is out now. I didn’t think the jokes dulled due to a longer format; I enjoyed binging on two or three episodes at a time. Also I’ve only seen a quarter of the show dubbed but I’d still like to share my thoughts. The dubbing did surprise me quality-wise and I enjoyed it. Definitely consider watching a little to see if it suits you. Since the comedy can be contextual I noticed slight differences that sometimes enhanced my watching experience.


The other aspects of the anime like music, art, and animation-are good. I’d just rather focus on the strong point of this show: its characters. Just like Saiki, the characters surprised me. Other times they were exactly how I thought and over time they grew on me. Essentially the characters definitely carry the heart and humor of this show.

Saiki Kusou was one of the best, yet more overlooked, anime of 2016. With each episode being only 4 minutes long every anime fan should watch atleast watch the first few and see if this is for you. 
Comedy is inherently subjective, but this was the first comedic anime where I consistently laughed at the jokes. The main character is one of the most OP in the history of anime - but where much of the comedy comes from is that these powers are more of a curse than a blessing. Typically each episode will focus on one of Saiki's powers, a new character, ora new situation, which prevents things from getting stale or jokes being reused, a flaw of many other similar anime. 


The technical aspects of Saiki Kusou are quite good. The standout is Saiki's VA - who does most of the talking (in an internal monologue - the character is almost mute) has an appropriate deadpan. The other character's voices also sound fine. The animation is nothing fancy, but is always on-model and attractive to the eye.

As a fan of action, mecha, sci-fi and dark fantasy animes, Saiki Kusuo no Sai Nan was an entirely new experience for me. On the whole, I'd say this is one of the best, if not the best Slice of Life/Comedy anime I've seen till date. In spite of having no strong plot line, it is both beautiful as well as exceptionally entertaining. The episodes are short and absolutely hilarious. Saiki, the protagonist is a 16-year-old schoolboy with psychic powers. One of the funniest parts is how he takes having superpowers to a whole new level. Be it teleportation, telepathy, turning invisible, superhuman strength nameit and he has can do it. There is practically nothing he can't do. The story mainly revolves around how he uses his powers to avoid attention while occasionally helping those in need. Although he repeatedly declares that he cares for no one but himself, as the story progresses you begin to realize that he actually cares way more than prefers to admit. As for the other characters, there is Nendou who is stupid to the point that his mind is empty and can't be read, the delusional Kaido, the ridiculously beautiful Teruhashi who spends most of her time making a good impression on others and many more. \n
Saiki and his friends are a rather odd bunch who are extremely lovable and at the same time downright hilarious. \n
Although the second season is rather repetitive, it is still entertaining as many new characters are introduced. \n
As the anime nears its end you can't help but feel touched as you realize that Saiki, as well as his friends, are actually great people.\n
Overall Saiki Kusuo no Sai Nan is an absolute masterpiece both in terms of uniqueness as well as character development. On a concluding note, I'd say that Saiki Kusuo no Sai Nan will make you laugh from the first episode to the very last. If you are a fan of Comedy animes  I'd definitely suggest this as a must watch.

I'm not one to sit down and watch a comedy, but this is definitely my favourite. Without a doubt.
The animation is probably the weakest part of the show. It's not the worst but it's not great. Also since Saiki speaks through telepathy, it's difficult to know when he's actually speaking.
The characters are what make the show great. There's a huge cast of memorable characters that are introduced throughout the two seasons. The tsundere grandpa, the idiot that's so dumb he doesn't have any thoughts, the guy with a superhero complex and the girl that is completely failing in terms of love are just some examplesof the interesting cast. 


They're not all just two dimensional characters, though.  Since Saiki knows what everyone (well, almost everyone) is thinking, it really gives some insight into who these people are and it's great.


The soundtrack is also pretty notable. It has some great openings, endings and just OST in general.

This anime is a pretty underrated gem and I definitely regret not watching sooner. I disregarded it as looking too goofy and just ignored it in my watch-list until this year. Yet it has quickly shot up to one of my favorite anime within the past year or two. 
Story: 9/10 Saiki Kusuo is a 4-5 minute per episode anime about a psychic that is inconvenienced by his powers and just wants to be an average person living an average life. If you're like me and dislike hitting the "next episode" button a lot due to the 4-5 minute episode schedule, then don't worry! There'sother options out there that let you watch it on a normal 24 minute anime runtime. There isn't really a main plotline other than a few rare mini-arcs in the show but it is endlessly entertaining. Saiki and his interactions with his school, friends, and family end up making some really lovable and hilarious moments that can get some laughs out of me. The story of each episode can be really hard to follow sometimes as Saiki and the humor is really fast-paced, but if you're a fast reader I don't think you'll have many problems. 


Art: 7/10 I'd normally give it a 6/10 as I feel it's pretty simplistic but I think Saiki being in the comedy genre gives the art an extra point for me. It's just too fitting for its show and characters.


Sound: 7/10 I'm not a big fan of the opening and endings of Saiki, but the OST and themes for each character are pretty great and entertaining. Especially Kaido's theme, the Judgement Knights of Thunder song makes me feel like I can survive a 50 foot story drop. 


Characters: 9/10 Each character has a lovable or unique niche that makes their interactions with each other really entertaining. It's hard for me to find a favorite because they're all really great in their own right. 


Overall: 9/10 I don't think I've had an anime make me laugh this hard since Nichijou. I highly recommend this show if you're looking for good comedy anime as those can be hard to come by.

Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan is the best gag/comedy anime that I’ve ever watched. It’s the perfect combination of absurd, ridiculous and heart-warming that keeps me compelled through every five minute segment. And yes, the episodes of this are only five minutes long. 
	• Don’t let the length of the episodes repel you from watching though. Unlike many other short anime series, the animation and designs are high quality with really, really high-profile Japanese voice actors doing the subtitles version. I’m not sure about the English dub, so I wouldn’t risk watching it unless someone told you it was really good and I still wouldn’t trustit, because the Japanese voices are perfect. And there’s Japanese humor and jokes that might be tossed in the back burner for the English script. 


	• Saiki, our hero, is voice by Araragi’s notorious actorーHiroshi Kamiya, who is officially the king of monologuing. He’s the best at it, at the ver least, but monologues actually make sense in this show, because the main character can practically read everyone in the worlds’ minds through telepathy. So, much of his dialogue is combatting weird shit that his classmates are thinking with witty, short rebuttals. 


	• This series is a like an improved version of One Punch Man, because’s it’s actually funny, and the main character has amazingly OP abilities that sometimes screw him over and sometimes save him from a bad situation. Like, being able to go back to the beginning of time and being able to delete something out of existence, so it won’t further hinder him. 


	• I’ve been focusing on Saiki this entire time, but the whole cast is likable, no matter how douche-baggy they may seem initially. There are the typical character archetypes such as: the pretty girl, the power in my right hand-chuuni-bro, the overly competitive-athletic guy, the girl who falls in love with every guy she sees, and a failed alcoholic magician. 


	• Initially, you think that all of these characters are going to be extremely typical, but Saiki being able to read their minds adds more depth to them. The cast grows on you and after a while, you feel like you’re watching a group of people you know in real life, doing crazy things. 


	• Saiki’s humor is somewhat spastic like Teekyu, but has an eloquence about it like Gintama. It became one of my favorite series in a short period of time, and I haven’t put a show past 2012 on my favorite list yet. So, to me, it’s been the best anime in four or so years. Between coffee jello, a sweet escape, and glorious laugh-out-loud moments, all of you should definitely watch Saiki Kusuo, it’s hasn’t gotten enough press in the West. I give Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan a 8/10 without any reservations.

I was somewhere in my house, on the edge of the bed, when the drugs began to take hold. I watched an Anime series that was as aware of itself as I was. The strange vision of a world devoid of a Fourth Wall sprang loose before my eyes, I remember a voice shouting, "What are these God darn animals?!" but as it turned out I wasn't on any drugs at all. I was simply watching, "Saiki Kusuo no Ψ-nan" AKA "The Disastrous Life of Saiki K."
This is an Anime show for Anime fans. Adapted from the popular manga series of the same name, thisfeels like what Deadpool would do if he were a PG-rated series. A series so full of colorful characters, mundane yet bizarre plots, and an MC who is perfectly aware that he is an Anime character in a TV show and also has so many powers that it would be pointless to throw challenges his way. If you know of a psychic power, he has it. All put to use in ways I can imagine using them myself and also for the most comedic of purposes. Add in a supporting cast of lovable goofballs and semi-antagonists, you have a perfect roster of people to bring this show to life beyond just a gimmick of fourth wall breaks.\n\n
The music and art are just a means to an end. The meat is in the writing and creative shows of Saiki's powers. Sub vs. Dub doesn't happen here. You need to watch this show in your native tongue. Subtitles alone cannot handle the rapid fire jokes that happen in a given moment. A throwaway line in the background can often be as if not more funny than the one we hear best. To say I enjoyed this show is a massive understatement. It's format of 5-minute episodes makes it easily binge worthy or for casual viewing if you just need a good chuckle. It is truly a wonderful show and is easily funnier than anything on TV right now. 8/10. Check it out. Cheers!

tl;dr: you liked Nichijou-like humor and you've seen a lot of anime? Watch this it's brilliant.
Saiki Kusuo no Psi-nan is one of my favorite anime. It's a gag anime that deconstructs many other genres in anime as well as manga, and does so brilliantly. There have been episodes where I was laughing out loud for a solid 10 seconds, which is something that happens extremely rarely for me when watching anime.
The type of humor it takes to enjoy this anime is similar to Nichijou or Asobi Asobase. If you liked those, you'll definitely like Saiki, but there's one problem...
Saiki (the show) is very much reference-based,and so it's probably best to not watch it until you've watched many different anime of many different genres. At least watch the major shounen, some romance, and some seinen.\n\n
The way Saiki deconstructs these other shows is brilliant, it sets up their premise and breaks them using Saiki's cynical disinterest. Really makes you think "yeah,.. maybe those shows are a waste of time and effort". Saiki also frames their premises in such a way to perfectly predict their outcomes.\n\n
To add in to this criticism and humor we have a wonderful cast of characters that are all memorable and in general very fun, except Mera, but hell I even remembered her name without looking it up. Just goes to show how strong the characters are in this show. The main cast is very much archetypal of different shows, for instance, Nendou is a bumbling but hilarious idiot who is super strong, much like some shounen protagonists, whereas Hairo is your typical "give 120%" character. Saiki basically criticizes these characters' ridiculousness and thereby transitively criticizes other anime and manga.\n\n
Absolutely a fantastic show - and - while the story/art/sound are all meh (really, there isn't a big story, it's very much SoL), the characters and enjoyment make up for it, easily.

This is one of my favorite feel good anime. It's a short form gag show about a deadpan cynical psychic who can alter the nature if the world if he wants too. 
I generally don't like comedy anime, but I could not stop watching Saiki Kusuo. The jokes are ridiculous and nonstop and the delivery is spot on. Most of the side characters are fantastic to watch from his bumbling parents to the "perfect pretty girl" who obsesses over him because he's the only person who could not be asked to care. 
For Saiki Kusuo it doesn't matter how powerful you are, the world doesn'tstop being stupid, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

REVIEW WITH NO SPOILERS
I never expected to have so much fun watching an anime.
The story follows a overpower high school boy surrounded by idiots.
That's it. The episodes have 5 minutes. And it's brilliant, because the humor is really clever and really absurd.
The animation is really solid and colorful, nothing unique but really pretty. I would not recommend if you want to think about life, complicated social questions watching an anime.
But if you're looking for an anime to pass the time, like watching while you're in the bus, this is really great. Or in the case you're looking for a wonderful comedy anime that's really practical,THIS IS IT.

Short and sweet, if you are looking for a comedy that breaks the fourth wall from time to time, has an OP protagonist that hates his power (in a "do I have to" kind of way), and really doesn't make a lot of sense, then this is the anime for you. It never goes too over the top, is usually good for a laugh, and has very short episodes in case you don't have a lot of time (they made 4-5 episodes make one story line but each 5 minute part is self contained. It is a surprisingly good format.)
Sound like something you'd like? Watchit!

“Anything that can go wrong will go wrong” -Murphys law
Firstly to get some things out of the way, the plot for this show is non-existent this isn’t a serious anime it’s an anime purely meant for enjoyment and comedy. Secondly the episodes are 5 minutes shorts collected into 23minute episodes and most of the shorts don’t have any relevance to the episode before however some shorts do which make for an enjoyable story arc. 
What I particularly liked about The Disastrous Life of Saiki was how it utilises Murphys Law in almost all of its shorts and then the writers use Saiki’s cunning and methodicalthinking paired up with his many supernatural powers (without letting others know about his abilities) to correct these problems or in some cases, endure the problem, this was a very original way of creating comedic effect and I applaud the writers for using this technique to make The Disastrous Life of Saiki a very original and enjoyable comedy anime. I also appreciated the side characters unique personalities and how it contrasted with Saiki’s bland and uncaring personality which I also like how Saiki’s views consistently contrasted with the side characters actions or views which made for some pretty comedic moments. Moreover I like how each short is unique in its own way and how the writers think up new gags to use in the shorts and also how each short is enjoyable and comedic.\n\n
I would recommend this anime to anyone who likes either the comedy genre or the supernatural genre because The Disastrous Life of Saiki is one of the very few anime that stand out among its genres by using different original ways to create comedy e.g Murphy law which made it a very interesting and enjoyable watch.

Actually, when I went looking for something to watch I was looking for a romantic drama anime.  Instead I found... this.
I can't stop laughing.  While watching this I did something I never ever do: I laughed out loud in room by myself.  I'm glad I wasn't drinking anything because I'd be cleaning it off my carpet right now instead of typing up this review.
You already know the plot, and honestly it's fairly repetitive.  Episode after episode, our MC is faced with the annoying, persistent, and hilarious challenges of being an overpowered psychic.  This shouldn't work, but somehow they pull itoff:


+ First and foremost, the voice actor for the MC is a genius at deadpan delivery.  Even though I can predict his lines most of the time, the way he delivers them often has me on the floor rolling.  It's silly at times, even puerile, but the main character is incredible due the performance of his seiyuu.  Also, not having a completely generic milksop for an MC is a nice change of pace.


+ The main character's parents are a hoot.  I am usually annoyed by such weak personalities that would drive their family to ruin within a year, but for some reason it is comedic gold they keep mining again and again.  


+ Supporting characters are also annoying as all get out, but again they make it work.  The writers are able to take their stereotypes and poke just enough fun at them to let us know we're also in on the joke.  


That's the key to the series really.  Instead of hoping that we are stupid viewers who will succumb to the common tropes of anime comedy (e.g. the MC trips and "accidentally" gropes a girl), they instead poke fun at the often lazy writing in the genre itself.  In fact, nearly an entire episode has the MC narrating by breaking the fourth wall and taking tongue-in-cheek shots at the anime industry by explaining how his psychic powers are the actual cause of all the odd realities in anime: like why the Japanese people have multi-colored hair in anime.


- The only thing I can think of that might detract from your enjoyment is if you can't see past the show's intentional attempts to annoy you and then defuse the annoyance with the MC's response to the situation.  That's their winning formula: how does an overpowered psychic deal with super-annoying situations?  If you're the type who gets too involved with what you're watching and puts yourself in his shoes (and into his troubles), then you'll be too annoyed to enjoy the humor.  For example, the personalities of the support characters are intentionally reprehensible.  The guy with the 8th grade syndrome is especially cringe-inducing, but his other "friends" are nearly as awful.  Seriously, none of the people surrounding Saiki are people you'd want to make friends with, not even the well-intentioned jock who helps everyone.


Sometimes you get lucky and you find something you weren't looking for and it's very, very good.  I keep telling myself I'm going to stop watching at the next episode and locate that romantic drama, but instead I let the next episode roll on to the next one, and the next one.  If you have a funny bone in your body somewhere you should watch this--but make sure you're not going to creep out anyone living with you by laughing hysterically.

I've watched this series in 2016 and re-watch it again in 2017. To anyone who are fans of good-quality comedy genre or super busy with their life but still want to enjoy some short good stress-relief, this anime is for you (as one episode lasts for 5 minutes) . As for my rating: 
Story: 10 
The reasons I give such an outstanding score is because this anime is not like your usual comedy anime. The comedy material are fresh every single episodes and none of them are reused to the point where you can just guess what this character will do comically. It gives youthis feeling of mind-blown of "how come this author could make such comedic scene like this". Furthermore, the story really captures the essence of the character and the comedic pace are not mundane. Is it re-watchable? Definitely yes!


Art: 7

The art itself doesn't look like it could attract many people to watch the anime due to the use of its generalized anime style. However, I could say each scene in this anime are vivid because not all character just sit still and watch another character doing something (ex: when Saiki speaks, you could see in the background Nendou and his friends are doing something silly, etc). This scene direction totally makes the viewer really engaged to the anime. 


Sound: 7 

If you seek for a memorable ost in this anime then there's none. HOWEVER, the way that the sound effect or the background music interacts with a certain scene being played is really spot on. (ex: certain character shocked, there's this TA-DAAH sfx that could portrayed the same shocks that the character feels). 


Character: 10

Do they look unique? Yes, heck even absurd. What about their personality? It totally suits their looks, bizarre and unique. (Ex: Kokomi looks like those popular and kind bishoujo girl. You think that she acts like she's really nice to people, much like the bishoujo archetype. However, she's a stuck-up narcissist who thinks that the world revolves around her.) This characteristic though, really gives the series a comedic punch right through the audience and makes them laugh at how stupid some character acts. 


Enjoyment: 9

 It's a good series, I dare you. You wouldn't even take your eyes off the screen because of how hilarious the character is and how unpredictable their action is; making you question what will happened next? The comedy itself could instantly make your day better! (I'm not exaggerating though)  


Overall: 9

Is it recommended to watch? Hell yeah! Get ready to feel the roller coaster of comedic fun!

The Disastrous Life of Saiki K. Overview
Merits:
-	Good Sense of Humour.
-	Very Likeable/Relatable Protagonist.
-	Use of Psychic Powers as a main theme.
-	Very likeable minor characters each with a specific personality.
Cons:
-	Each episode is split up into 4 parts which can slow the pace slightly; also I am not a fan of it.
-	Even through each character has a specific personality they feel somewhat shallow sometimes but not always.
-	School theme is very common; I don’t mind it but prefer something unique.
IS THAT A GIANT HAMBURGER POTATO HYBRID WITH QUANTUM LASER TORPEDOS!? No? Oh…want to get some McQuackers; I’m kind of hungry now.
Random comedy is my favourite comedy, this is always apparentwith anime too. Because anime (this can also relate to Western Cartoons too) have no boundaries in which the comedy can flow they can pretty much do whatever they want. On the over hand everyone has a different style of comedy and find certain things funny that others do not, even though because of this we have a diverse range of comedy to pick from. Saiki Kusou no Psi-Nan has top notch comedy in my book but is that because of my personal preference; for example I like Saiki’s personality and the fact that he finds pretty much all normal things pointless and boring because his psychic powers allow him to pretty much anything.\n\n
The greatest comedy comes from the fact that Saiki which simply wants a quiet and peaceful life ends up accidently making somewhat reasonable decisions, which for some reason turns out disastrous. For example he makes friends with people even though he doesn’t want any but this can be down to there singular personalities.\n\n
Riki Nendo – Saiki can’t read his mind and thus makes it difficult to predict what he’s going to do, reading minds is one of Saiki’s powers. Although due to Nendo being a complete idiot, it makes it impossible for Saiki to read his mind. Nendo ends up becoming friends with Saiki regardless of Saiki’s choice in the matter.\n\n
Shun Kaido – Suffers from 8th Grader Syndrome as Saiki calls it, thinks he’s the protagonist for some fantasy anime and thinks that Dark Reunion will be the end of us. He can be quite funny at times considering even though he thinks he’s some powerful fighter in reality he’s really weak.\n\n
Kokomi Teruhashi – The prettiest girl in school, or how this anime portrays her to be the prettiest girl in the world. She’s extremely self aware about this and thinks that all boys should worship her and acknowledge her beauty. Saiki on the other hand see’s everyone as flesh and bones, once Teruhashi realises this she goes out of her way to get Saiki to achnowledge her.\n
Kineshi Hairo – The class-rep and is all about spirit and willpower to do and overcome everything. Not much else to say about him sweats a lot and shows his ass quite often. Don’t really find him funny.\n\n
I won’t go over any other characters as it’s unnecessary.\n\n
I’m not much of a reviewer; I don’t think I spoiled anything for you. Saiki is just straight up funny, but considering my favorite comedy anime is Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo my comedy is quite obscure. I found this series to be funny and you might as well.\n\n
Please keep in mind again that my comedy is obscure, I find Bobobo funny but Gintama not funny. This is mainly due to Gintama having hit or miss comedy for me and the pacing being thrown off when it gets serious, like how can you try to do both? Just completely takes me out of it and I lose interest. I have tried to get into Gintama (just look at all the seasons I’ve watched) but just find the comedy unbalanced and when it gets serious boring. Sorry to go off on Gintama just wanted you to get a complete understanding of my comedy.\n\n
Saiki I give a 7/10\n
